full_text.full_text:
(Ex) Predicting the Type of a Flower
▪ Consider the task of predicting a species of flower based on the 
characteristics of the flower
– Species: y  {‘Setosa’, ‘Versicolour’, ‘Virginica’}
– Petal length: x1  [0, 7]
– Petal width: x2  [0, 2.5]
There can
be errors
▪ We may build a model f(x1, x2)
as follows:
‘Setosa’           if
x1  [0, 2.5)
x2  [0, 0.75)
f(x1, x2) =
‘Verisicolour’  if
‘Virginica’      if
x1  [2.5, 5)
x2  [0.75, 1.75) 
x1  [5, 7]
x2  [1.75, 2.5]
34
